hints.content:
The area is the number of unit squares it takes to cover the rectangle.

![Same rectangle with width labeled 5 and height labeled 9.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b907497fbdd42e13749f1c9f59f7b208438515a0)

The rectangle has $\tealE{9}$ rows with $\goldE{5}$ unit squares per row.

###Repeated addition

We can find the area by adding the unit squares from each column:

$\underbrace{\tealE{9}+\tealE{9}+\tealE{9}+\tealE{9}+\tealE{9}}_{\goldE{5}\text{ columns}}$

###Multiplication

We can also write repeated addition as multiplication:

$\tealE{9}+\tealE{9}+\tealE{9}+\tealE{9}+\tealE{9}=\goldE{5} \times \tealE{9}$

We multiply $\goldE{\text{width}} \times \tealE{\text{height}}$.

We can use these expressions to find the area of the rectangle:

- $9+9+9+9+9$
- $5 \times 9$

question.content:
![a square.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/bc67f4f0e4d41e9098b84a93e5fcfbef2cda7d8e) is $1$ unit square.

![a rectangle 5 squares wide and 9 squares high.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/59e744549ebb4283466c6895615acc2fee5bae0b)

**Which expressions can we use to find the area of the rectangle?**
